page.title: 11Visitors to Beacon Hill
page.content: Beacon Hill 185 acres of public open space is the main attraction for tourists being a country park with a scheduled Ancient Monument & splendid panoramic views of great geological interest.Facilities include car parking just below the summit (20p charge),a toilet block & a toposcope. In the rocky outcrops a visitor can clearly see the different coloured layers of volcanic ash.Very popular for regular & frequent visits with young people,families & the retired from Charnwood,Leic & Notts,it also attracts specialists from much further afield.There is some rock climbing, flying of kites,model aeroplanes & an ice cream van attends at popular times.Nearby is Broombriggs Farm Trail 2 miles of footpath through a working farm owned by Leics CC who publish leaflets for both.Bye_laws apply.
